# Transaction.RefundRequestError

**Enumeration**

The error codes for refund requests.

## Declaration

```swift
enum RefundRequestError
```

## Overview

The following methods throw refund request errors: [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/Transaction/beginRefundRequest(in:)-9k0pj], [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/Transaction/beginRefundRequest(for:in:)-65tph], [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/Transaction/beginRefundRequest(in:)-63bvd], and [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/Transaction/beginRefundRequest(for:in:)-9mscy].

## Error Enumeration

- **Transaction.RefundRequestError.duplicateRequest**: The App Store has already received a refund request for this in-app purchase.
- **Transaction.RefundRequestError.failed**: The refund request submission failed.

## Requesting refunds

- **Testing refund requests**: Test your app’s implementation of refund requests, and your app’s and server’s handling of approved and declined refunds.
- **beginRefundRequest(in:)**: Presents the refund request sheet for the transaction in a window scene.
- **beginRefundRequest(in:)**: Presents the refund request sheet for the transaction in a view controller.
- **beginRefundRequest(for:in:)**: Presents the refund request sheet for the specified transaction in a window scene.
- **beginRefundRequest(for:in:)**: Presents the refund request sheet for the specified transaction in a view controller.
- **Transaction.RefundRequestStatus**: The status codes for refund requests.

## Conforms To

- Copyable
- Equatable
- Error
- Hashable
- LocalizedError
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
